result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent. 

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is entered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Plead no contest to the charge.  Court advised the charges and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court finds that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as plead to.    Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. s/m full time employment.  Defendant did not elect to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. Maintain employment.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Comply with any recommendations of the agent.  CC.
Plea hearing at 08-24-2015 01:30 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Set for plea.   8/24/15 at 1:30 pm
Status conference at 07-20-2015 03:00 pm.

15CM124 - Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss, who appeared specially.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Poss states the defendant still needs to apply for representation.  Waived reading of the complaint and stood mute.  Court entered NGP and set for pretrial on 7-1-15 and status on 7-20-15 at 3:00.  15CM05 status rescheduled to 7-20-15.
Status conference at 06-29-2015 03:00 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  STC set for 6/29/15 at 3 pm
Status conference at 04-27-2015 03:00 pm

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendnat appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Plea not held today.  Attorney Poss advised the court that defendant is hiring Attorney John Matousek to represent him on all open cases.  Attorney Poss only represents the defendant on 15CM5, and does not object.  If defendant signs an authorization to appear for Attorney Matousek, he will not have to appear at the 4/27/15 STC.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-06-2015 01:30 pm
Cheryl Sisco court reporter.  ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Poss.  Schedule for plea/sentencing on 4/6/15 at 1:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 02-18-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 03-09-2015 03:00 pm.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Reading of complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute to charge.   Court entered NGP.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
ADA Inlow appeared on behal of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without attorney.  Defendant wants an attorney.  Court explains options.  AIA set for 1/26/15.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
